item.title: Maski: Karnataka’s Small Town With a 6,000-year Civilisational Legacy
item.description:
<![CDATA[Maski, a small town in Karnataka’s Raichur district, may look modest today, but to historians and archaeologists it is a living museum chronicling India’s civilisational journey. From prehistoric settlements and Mauryan rule to Chola invasions and the Nizam era, Maski has carried forward layers of history for at least 6,000 years.
Recent excavations led by Dr. Hemanth Kadambi of Shiv Nadar University, along with international scholars, have brought Maski back into focus. Though findings are yet...]]>
item.author: Gururaj A Paniyadi, About The Author, Principal Correspondent With Deccan Chronicle, Specializes In Covering Coastal, North Karnataka Districts. His Expertise Lies In Political Analysis, He Holds A Profound Interest In Human Interest Stories, History, Culture. Offering Extensive Coverage, Gururaj Explores Various Facets, Including Politics
